name: hatsune-miku-theme
description: A dark colour theme based on Hatsune Miku for vs code.

viewsWelcome.contents:
The below options will only change things within the editor.
THIS IS STILL A WORK IN PROGRESS.
New updates will unfortunately reset any changes made to the editor before the update, so expect you needing to reinput values every once in a while until the completion of this project.
[Change Background Colour or Transparency](command:changeDisplayedView?["B"])
[Change Border Colour or Transparency](command:changeDisplayedView?["C"])
[Change Colours of Syntax](command:changeDisplayedView?["D"])

[Return](command:returnPreviousDisplayedView)
Each button will give the option to change the background of one thing within the editor.
[Change Background Of Thing Selected With Cursor](command:changeDisplayedView?["_changecolourWordHighlightBackground__changetransparencyWordHighlightBackground_"])
[Change Background Of Line The Cursor Is On](command:changeDisplayedView?["_changecolourLineHighlightBackground__changetransparencyLineHighlightBackground_"])

[Return](command:returnPreviousDisplayedView)
Each button will give the option to change the border of one thing within the editor.
[Change Border Selected With Cursor](command:changeDisplayedView?["_changecolourWordHighlightBorder__changetransparencyWordHighlightBorder_"])
[Change Border Of Line The Cursor Is On](command:changeDisplayedView?["_changecolourLineHighlightBorder__changetransparencyLineHighlightBorder_"])

[Change To View B](command:changeDisplayedView?["B"])
This will change the background of variables, functions, classes, numbers, booleans and strings which are selected with the cursor.
[Change Colour](command:changeThemeEditor.changecolourWordHighlightBackground)
[Change Transparency](command:changeThemeEditor.changetransparencyWordHighlightBackground)
This changes the border of variables, functions, classes, numbers, booleans and strings which are selected with the cursor.
[Change Colour.](command:changeThemeEditor.changecolourWordHighlightBorder)
[Change Transparency](command:changeThemeEditor.changetransparencyWordHighlightBorder)
This is a WIP more will be added over time.

[Change To View A](command:changeDisplayedView?["A"])
[Return To View A](command:returnPreviousDisplayedView)
